midas/examples/lowlevel/rpc_srvr.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003   Name:         rpc_srvr.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     A simple RPC server program. Implements a function
00007                 rpc_test, which simply doubles some parameters.
00008                 This function can be calles remotely by rpc_clnt.
00009 
00010 
00011   $Log: rpc_srvr.c,v $
00012   Revision 1.1.1.1  2005/06/20 23:37:11  mucap
00013   Importing release 1.9.5 of the MIDAS source code as distributed by PSI.
00014   (Next, I'll commit our local customizations.)
00015 
00016   Revision 1.3  2004/01/08 08:40:09  midas
00017   Implemented standard indentation
00018 
00019   Revision 1.2  1999/10/26 11:20:43  midas
00020   Fixed wrong parameters in rpc_set_debug
00021 
00022   Revision 1.1  1999/04/27 11:10:56  midas
00023   Added files to CVS
00024 
00025 
00026 \********************************************************************/
00027 
00028 #include "midas.h"
00029 #include <stdio.h>
00030 
00031 #define RPC_MYTEST RPC_MIN_ID
00032 
00033 RPC_LIST rpc_list[] = {
00034 
00035    {RPC_MYTEST, "rpc_mytest",
00036     {{TID_BYTE, RPC_IN}
00037      ,
00038      {TID_WORD, RPC_IN}
00039      ,
00040      {TID_INT, RPC_IN}
00041      ,
00042      {TID_FLOAT, RPC_IN}
00043      ,
00044      {TID_DOUBLE, RPC_IN}
00045      ,
00046      {TID_BYTE, RPC_OUT}
00047      ,
00048      {TID_WORD, RPC_OUT}
00049      ,
00050      {TID_INT, RPC_OUT}
00051      ,
00052      {TID_FLOAT, RPC_OUT}
00053      ,
00054      {TID_DOUBLE, RPC_OUT}
00055      ,
00056      {0}
00057      }
00058     }
00059    ,
00060 
00061    {0}
00062 
00063 };
00064 
00065 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00066 
00067 /* just a small test routine which doubles numbers */
00068 INT rpc_mytest(BYTE b, WORD w, INT i, float f, double d,
00069                BYTE * b1, WORD * w1, INT * i1, float *f1, double *d1)
00070 {
00071    *b1 = b * 2;
00072    *w1 = w * 2;
00073    *i1 = i * 2;
00074    *f1 = f * 2;
00075    *d1 = d * 2;
00076 
00077    return 1;
00078 }
00079 
00080 /* this dispatchers forwards RPC calls to the destination functions */
00081 INT rpc_dispatch(INT index, void *prpc_param[])
00082 {
00083    INT status;
00084 
00085    switch (index) {
00086    case RPC_MYTEST:
00087       status = rpc_mytest(CBYTE(0), CWORD(1), CINT(2), CFLOAT(3), CDOUBLE(4),
00088                           CPBYTE(5), CPWORD(6), CPINT(7), CPFLOAT(8), CPDOUBLE(9));
00089       break;
00090 
00091    default:
00092       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_dispatch", "received unrecognized command");
00093    }
00094 
00095    return status;
00096 }
00097 
00098 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00099 
00100 main()
00101 {
00102    INT status, port;
00103 
00104    /* register RPC server under port 1750 */
00105    port = 1750;
00106    status = rpc_register_server(ST_REMOTE, "", &port, NULL);
00107    if (status != RPC_SUCCESS) {
00108       printf("Cannot start server");
00109       return 0;
00110    }
00111 
00112    /* Register function list. Calls get forwarded to rpc_dispatch */
00113    rpc_register_functions(rpc_list, rpc_dispatch);
00114 
00115    /* Print debugging messages */
00116    rpc_set_debug((void (*)(char *)) puts, 0);
00117 
00118    /* Server loop */
00119    while (cm_yield(1000) != RPC_SHUTDOWN);
00120 
00121    /* Shutdown server */
00122    rpc_server_shutdown();
00123 
00124    return 1;
00125 }
